title: I know I might be salty...But holy moly is Warlord's bloodlust frustrating!
body:
Seriously, ESPECIALLY on these *insert various curse words known to man here* {{champion:157}}  {{champion:23}} 

Imagine this scenario;
Preseason 6 on summoner's rift.
Malicious Metal enters the game and goes all like "Hmm...My opponent is Tryndamere, better start cloth 4"
So I waddle to lane, convinced this should be enough to cover up my shitty base armor for the time being, the pots probably being enough to sustain me in conjunction with Grasp of the Undying.

I get one, two minions. Then the guy spins on me and starts whacking me, critting me not once, not twice but Three times in four attacks, rendering ALL my damage useless and resulting in me biting the dust.
Fair enough, I might just play passively,
But no, getting dived the moment he hit 6, barely surviving and seeing him heal to full life within seconds only to once again try diving me and succeeding.

Long story short; We needed FOUR people to actually kill the guy, getting even more bonkers once he got low.

I get that this is the "ADC patch" but damn, Riot should have thought that maybe, just maybe crib-based melee carries would become even more obnoxious due to the "free" Lifesteal AND Attack speed.

It gets worse if you compare it to the other masteries. Strategic diversity? More like one keystone mastery being the undisputed king of frustration resulting in undying rage to spread like a plague.

How this got through is still beyond me?
Why?
Just why?

~M.M
A very, very salty Mordekaiser player

try playing jungle and having only warrior/boots/cloth armor by 15 minutes in because as a jungler you are so poor, that's all you can afford while the ADC masters take half of your camps. At least you can buy items.

I saw a thread a bit ago that suggested {{item:2303}} for junglers. Since junglers occasionally build sightstone anyways you can get the eye to supplement your low gold and use it by taking "tax free" tax from your laners after you gank.

Haven't tried it yet, but if you are having an issue with gold might be worth a try?

so I'm talking more about playing a jungler to hard carry a game. If you see my most played, I climbed up to plat 1 in season 5 using primarily carry junglers: Hecarim, Master Yi and Shyvana. I also play tanky tops and supports and surprise surprise, they are also getting nerfed. All 3 of my most played are now almost unviable because you still need to buy your core damage item + tankiness, however, now everything costs way more. In particular, tank items cost far more money yet had their stats reduced, while jungler income has been reduced due to no more +30 bonus gold.

They say that the increased ambient gold makes up for it. It doesn't. That gold is for everyone. That means junglers hit their power spikes later and need to tax lanes more just to not fall behind. If I buy a sightstone, then I'm going to be playing a support jungler instead of a carry or tanky jungler. So does this mean I should only play support junglers from now on?

Meanwhile ADCs have the best itemization ever.
Well I can definitely see Hec getting nerfed by all these changes, but Yi should be doing ok (not good, but ok). Shyvana has definitely been hit the hardest, since she is quite literally unplayable.

Most people say "Nerf Yasuo or Nerf Trynd" but the problem is with the mastery itself. I propose changes to it.

Warlord's Bloodlust:
Lifesteal 5/10/15% off a critical strike (only occurs once while off CD and only on Champs) while also gaining 10/15/20% attack speed for 3 seconds (Levels that change is 1/7/13)
(CD is 10 seconds but reduces by 1 for each minion that you succesfully last hit with/or champ that you kill or assist  which is refrencing to the "bloodlust")

This way if you want to do tons of damage you have to really commit to it and only gain the life steal once in a while and you have to know when to commit and when to back off rather than mindlessly rightclicking.

Before both full masteries & runes gave you one end-tier item worth of stats.

Now? Runes give you about 1 low-mid tier item and masteries about 1 and a half end-game item..

Sigh.

This game getting dumber & faster with every patch.

Yeah Yasuo and Tyrnd are going to cause problems for the mastery (because lets be honest, they'll nerf the mastery before them).  Can't say I've found myself really enjoying it, went {{champion:80}} with it vs {{champion:31}}.  Felt like I needed to relearn my champion (I'm normally not even bad at last hitting with Panth!) because I felt useless after his first back.  I probably could have built better (never did get to try the new essence reaver and triforce combo that match.  Had to buy giant slayer and some armor pen to be effective) and the lack of mana pots (Potion of corruption did not feel satisfactory) really messed me up.  I may just switch to deathfire grasp and put my 12 points in the resolve tree for top Pantheon.  

I have not yet fought a {{champion:157}} or {{champion:23}}.  I am not looking forward to facing them.

I did warlord's on Pantheon, outsustained a Lee without even buying any potions. It's trickier on Pantheon than Trynd/Yas though, because you eventually get enough AD to last hit without managing to proc his E crit and get no sustain. It took me a while to get the rhythm but once I got it, i stayed in lane until I got a black cleaver and shoes on first back. That's how strong it is, but imagine it on champs that get it on any autoattack. Trynd hits 2 or 3 times and gets a heal. Backs off for 2 seconds, and goes up and gets another heal the same way. GL kicking him out of lane. *p.s. he got another Q heal on top of all that so yea...*

And on Yasuo, he was supposed to have a weakness of "LACK OF SUSTAIN" which makes him forced to buy lifesteal if he wants it, sacrificing damage. Now he rushes Shiv and cloak, lo and behold, he has 15% lifesteal now in addition to his power spike. And then proceeds to farm up the lane and hypercarry like Yasuos all do. Only that you can't shut him down in lane anymore.
Or remove crit from the game as they said they would since it's such a big problem FOR EVERY CHAMPION.
